intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. pseudopraecox, commonly known as the early spearthistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It has a biennial or perennial life cycle, with the flowering stage occurring in the second year. The species is notable for its distinctive leaf morphology, which includes deeply lobed and sometimes bifurcated leaves.
